Pre-Game Insights: Gabon will host Lesotho at Stade de Franceville in a 2025 Africa Cup of Nations qualifying match on Friday evening.
Gabon rebounded from a 4-1 drubbing by Morocco in the opening game of their AFCON qualifying series by securing a 2-0 victory over Central African Republic in their second match.
Lesotho kicked off their AFCON qualifying campaign with a 3-1 defeat to Central African Republic in the first round of qualifiers and were forced to react in their second game against Morocco.
Gabon have won their last three home matches, while Lesotho are winless in their last six games.
A front three of Aubameyang, Babicka and Denis Bouanga is expected to lead the line for Gabon.
Lesotho have called up five new players to their 31-man provisional squad, including 19-year-old Paseka Maile, who made his senior team debut at the COSAFA Cup earlier this year.
